document_data.mainbody:
Zhiir was on of the illithids who ran the Black Market, hidden in the mountains to the east from Samargol in the jungle nation of Samarach circa 1374 DR.
Sometime before the , a mind flayer seer OinChakalop psychically touched the mind of a mad god. This left OinChakalops aberrant mind shattered, incapable of speech. Zhiir took the ex-seer under his wing to work as a servant in the Black Market. Zhiirs business was dealing with select clients only. Some had to commit murder to get on the illithids customer list. He collected and procured rare magical tomes for those wealthy enough to pay for the service. In 1374 DR, one such client requested a book of elemental magic lore compiled by a wizardly cabal in Samarach for a fee of 10,000 gold pieces. The book was written and pending delivery until the carriers went dark on Zhiir. The illithid was looking for a hireling capable of infiltrating the mage tower called the Tempests Fury and recovering the missing arcane tome.
The book in question collected research notes on summoning and "enhancing" various elemental creatures from the planes. The magical procedures used to achieve that goal were utterly torturous and driven most summoned elementals mad with pain and suffering. One of such summoned beings was a djinni Shamal who suffered the empowering rituals but proved too powerful to remain restrained by a binding circle. Driven mad by torture, Shamal decimated the cabal and took over the tower. The book of Zhiirs research remained locked away in the Tempests Furys hidden vault.
